## Data wrangling
```{r}
#| results: false
#| code-fold: true
focus <- "Antarctica"
lon0 <- 0
lat0 <- -90
proj <- str_glue("+proj=ortho lon_0={lon0} lat_0={lat0}")
```

```{r}
#| results: false
#| code-fold: true
world <- st_read("data/world.gpkg") %>%
  st_make_valid() %>%
  select(CONTINENT) %>%
  st_transform(proj) %>%
  st_make_valid() %>%
  filter(!st_is_empty(.)) %>%
  group_by(CONTINENT) %>%
  summarise() 

continent <- world %>%
  filter(CONTINENT == focus)

graticule <- get_graticule(spacing = 15)
```

## `tmap`
```{r}
tm_shape(world) +
  tm_fill() + 
  tm_shape(graticule) +
  tm_lines(col = "lightgrey", lwd = 0.5) +
  tm_compass(cardinal.directions = c("UP", "S", "E", "W")) +
  tm_layout(frame = FALSE)
```

## `ggplot2`
We need [`ggspatial`](https://paleolimbot.github.io/ggspatial/) for a north arrow here.

But even then, to customize it I have to make my own function.

```{r}
#| code-fold: true
up_arrow <- function(line_width = 0.5, line_col = "black", 
                                fill = "black", text_col = "black", 
                                text_family = "", text_face = NULL,
                                text_size = 8) {
  text_label = "UP"
  text_adj = c(0.5, 0.5)

  grid::gList(
    grid::polygonGrob(
      x = c(0.6, 0.5, 0.5),
      y = c(0.35, 0.9, 0.45),
      default.units = "npc",
      gp = grid::gpar(
        lwd = line_width,
        col = line_col,
        fill = fill
      )
    ),
    grid::polygonGrob(
      x = c(0.4, 0.5, 0.5),
      y = c(0.35, 0.9, 0.45),
      default.units = "npc",
      gp = grid::gpar(
        lwd = line_width,
        col = line_col,
        fill = NULL
      )
    ),
    grid::textGrob(
      label = text_label,
      x = 0.5,
      y = 1,
      hjust = text_adj[0],
      vjust = text_adj[1],
      rot = 0,
      gp = grid::gpar(
        fontfamily = text_family,
        fontface = text_face,
        fontsize = text_size,
        col = text_col
      )
    )
  )
}
```


```{r}
library(ggspatial)

ggplot(world) +
  geom_sf(linewidth = 0) +
  geom_sf(data = graticule, col = "lightgrey", linewidth = 0.25) +
  annotation_north_arrow(location = "br", style = up_arrow) + 
  theme_void()
```
